{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Use British English|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Matthew Pennington | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Matthew Pennington{{cite web |title = List of Players under Written Contract Registered Between 01/02/2014 and 28/02/2014 |url = http://www.thefa.com/~/media/files/thefaportal/governance-docs/registrations/february-2014.ashx |publisher = The Football Association |format = PDF |page = 13 |accessdate = 6 April 2014}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1994|10|6|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Warrington]], England | height = {{convert|1.85|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.overview.html/matthew-pennington |title=Barclays Premier League Player Profile Matthew Pennington |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=6 November 2012}} | position = [[Centre back]] | currentclub = [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]]
(on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 2005–2013 | youthclubs1 = [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|Everton]] | years1 = 2013– | clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps1 = 7 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2014 | clubs2 = → [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] (loan) | caps2 = 17 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2014–2015 | clubs3 = → [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] (loan) | caps3 = 24 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2016 | clubs4 = → [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] (loan) | caps4 = 5 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2017–2018 | clubs5 = → [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] (loan) | caps5 = 24 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = → [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] (loan) | caps6 = 25 | goals6 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 15:41, 12 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Matthew Pennington''' (born 6 October 1994) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]. He has represented the [[England national under-19 football team]] (the England U19s) at the international level. ==Club career== ===Everton=== Pennington joined [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at the age of 11. In July 2013, he signed a new contract which would keep him at the club until the summer of 2015,{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/player-profile/matthew-pennington|title=So Close...|publisher=Everton F.C.}} followed by a three-year deal taking him to 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/07/07/matthew-pens-new-deal|title=Matthew Pens New Deal|publisher=Everton F.C.}} He played in two friendlies during July 2015 against [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]] and [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] and then made his full debut against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] on 26 August 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/08/27/martinez-praises-debutant-pennington|title=Martinez Praises Debutant Pennington|publisher=Everton F.C.}} ====Tranmere Rovers (loan)==== On 2 January 2014, Pennington joined [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] on a one month's loan deal.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25568665|title=Tranmere Rovers: Liam Ridehalgh rejoins ahead of permanent deal|publisher=BBC Sport}} He made his debut on 4 January 2014, playing ninety minutes in a 1–1 draw with [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/01/01/england/league-one/tranmere-rovers-fc/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/1484848/|title=Tranmere Rovers vs. Wolverhampton Wanderers – 1 January 2014 |website=Soccerway}} On 25 January 2014, he scored his first senior goal in a 1–0 win over [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/01/25/england/league-one/tranmere-rovers-fc/crewe-alexandra-fc/1484894/|title=Tranmere Rovers vs. Crewe Alexandra – 25 January 2014 |website=Soccerway}} He was recalled by Everton on 22 February 2014 to strengthen their under-21 squad.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/league1/news/20140224/matthew-kennedy-and-matthew-pennington-recalled-from-tranmere-rovers_2293324_3684860|title=Latest Sky Bet League 1 News|publisher=The Football League|access-date=16 March 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140316061656/http://www.football-league.co.uk/league1/news/20140224/matthew-kennedy-and-matthew-pennington-recalled-from-tranmere-rovers_2293324_3684860#|archive-date=16 March 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} On 27 March 2014, he re-joined Tranmere on loan until the end of the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2014/03/27/trio-loaned-out|title=So Close...|publisher=Everton F.C.}} ====Coventry (loan)==== On 27 November 2014, Pennington joined [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on loan until 4 January,{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2014/11/27/pennington-loaned-to-coventry|title=Pennington Loaned To Coventry|publisher=Everton F.C.}} and this was subsequently extended to 7 February.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30637098|title=Matty Pennington: Everton defender extends Coventry loan|publisher=BBC Sport}} In January 2015, he was voted as the club's Player of the Month in a poll conducted by the ''[[Coventry Telegraph]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/sport/football/football-news/everton-loan-star-matthew-pennington-8411797|title=Everton loan star Matthew Pennington is YOUR Coventry City Telegraph Player of the Month|author=Aidan McCartney|date=9 January 2015|newspaper=Coventry Telegraph}} On 7 February 2015, his loan was extended to the end of the season, with Pennington from then on being played more consistently at his more natural centre back position.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31312083|title=Matthew Pennington: Coventry City extend defender's loan deal|publisher=BBC Sport}} Pennington was named as Coventry City Young Player of the Year 2014–15, voted for unanimously by Coventry City manager Tony Mowbray and his coaching staff.{{cite web|url=http://www.ccfc.co.uk/news/article/matthew-pennington-young-player-coventry-city-2444127.aspx|title=Matthew Pennington voted as the Coventry City 2014/15 Young Player of the Year|author=Kieran Crowley|publisher=Coventry City F.C.}}{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/05/06/pennington-picks-up-sky-blues-award|title=Pennington picks up Sky Blues award|publisher=Everton F.C.}} ====Walsall (loan)==== On 23 March 2016, Pennington joined [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] on loan until the end of the season,{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/03/24/pennington-loaned-to-walsall|title=Pennington loaned to Walsall|publisher=Everton F.C.}} where he played 5 games at the club, before Everton activated a recall clause just 28 days into his loan spell. ====Everton return==== On 21 April 2016, his loan was terminated at the minimum 28-day point due to a defensive crisis at his home club.{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-recall-matthew-pennington-loan-11223814|title=Everton recall Matthew Pennington|publisher=Everton F.C.}} He was recalled to be available for Everton's FA Cup semi-final against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]. After picking up a hamstring injury in the final day of the [[Premier League]] 2015/16 season on 15 May 2016 in a 3–0 victory against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]],{{cite web|title=Everton 3 Norwich 0|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240381|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=15 May 2016|accessdate=15 May 2016|first=Neil|last=Johnstone}} a recurrence of the injury in pre-season required surgery and ruled Pennington out until January 2017.{{cite web|title=Pennington on comeback trail|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/01/09/pennington-on-comeback-trail|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=8 January 2017|accessdate=18 July 2017|first=Rob|last=Urbani}} After returning from injury, his first goal came on 1 April 2017, in the [[Merseyside derby]] against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], equalising the game at 1–1, in an eventual 3–1 loss.{{cite web|title=Liverpool 3–1 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39390276|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 April 2017|accessdate=1 April 2017|quote=Jagielka flicked on a corner at the near post and, after Ashley Williams got a touch, Matthew Pennington arrived to slot in his first Everton goal on his first appearance of the season.|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera}} ====Leeds United (loan)==== On 19 July 2017, Pennington joined [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] on a season-long loan,{{cite web|title=Everton Defender Joins on Loan| url=https://www.leedsunited.com/news/team-news/22082/pennington-leeds|publisher=Leeds United F.C.|date=19 July 2017}}{{cite|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/07/18/pennington|title=Pennington joins Leeds on loan|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=19 July 2017}} for a reported loan fee of £500,000.{{cite web|publisher=talkSPORT|date=4 September 2017|url=https://talksport.com/radio/listen-again/1504501200|accessdate=5 September 2017|series=The Alan Brazil Sports Breakfast|title=Monday, September 4, 2017|first=Joey|last=Barton}} On 6 August 2017, Pennington made his Leeds United debut in the 3–2 victory against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]], he picked up an ankle injury in the match and had to be replaced by fellow debutant [[Conor Shaughnessy]] in the 2nd half.{{cite web|url=https://www.leedsunited.com/news/team-news/22152/report-bolton-wanderers-2-3-leeds-united|title=REPORT: BOLTON WANDERERS 2–3 LEEDS UNITED|publisher=Leeds United F.C.|date=6 August 2017}} He was unavailable until the latter half of September, when he returned to the bench.{{Cite news|url=https://www.footballinsider247.com/close-christiansen-delivers-fitness-update-leeds-united-duo/|title=Leeds United news: Pennington and Cooper set to return v Ipswich|date=18 September 2017|website=Football Insider|access-date=14 November 2017}} In October, following inconsistent results for the team, Pennington returned intermittently to the starting eleven. After 24 appearances, on 18 May 2018, Leeds announced Pennington would be returning to his parent club upon the expiry of his loan.{{cite news|newspaper=Yorkshire Evening Post|date=18 May 2018|accessdate=18 May 2018|title=LEEDS UNITED 2018/19 RETAINED LIST |url=https://www.leedsunited.com/news/team-news/23386/leeds-united-2018-19-retained-list}} ====Return to Everton==== He returned to [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] to play in the 2018/19 pre season under their new Manager [[Marco Silva]], on 11 May 2018 Pennington signed a new long term contract at the club keeping him there until the end of the 2021 season.{{cite news|newspaper=BBC Sport|date=11 May 2018|accessdate=3 August 2018|title=Matthew Pennington signs new contract at Everton until 2021|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44088619}} ====Ipswich Town (loan)==== On 31 August 2018, Pennington joined [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2018/08/31/pennington-joins-ipswich-on-loan|title=Pennington joins Ipswich on loan|publisher=Everton F.C.}} He scored his first goal for the club in a 2-2 draw against [[Birmingham City]] on 29 September 2018, however he was later sent off in the same match.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45609718|title=Birmingham 2-2 Ipswich Town |publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=29 September 2018|accessdate=1 October 2018}} ==International career== Pennington made his debut for [[England national under-19 football team|England U19s]] on 21 March 2013, coming on as a 70th-minute substitute in a 1–0 win over [[Turkey national under-19 football team|Turkey]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u19s/News/2013/turkey-report-210313|title=TheFA.com – Report: England U19s 1–0 Turkey U19s|publisher=The Football Association}} He was selected by [[Noel Blake]] after a performance against Arsenal in the [[FA Youth Cup]], where he played at right back, a position he had only figured in a few times in his career at the time.{{cn|date=July 2017}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|end of 2017–18 season}} {| class=wikitable style="text-align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !102||4||2||0||1||0||1||0||106||4 |} {{notelist}} ==Honours== '''Individual''' *[[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] Young Player of the Year: [[2014–15 Coventry City F.C. season|2014–15]]
